meanings.definition: The state or quality of lacking emotion or sensitivity.
meanings.sent1: Her unfeelingnesses made it hard for her to connect with others.
meanings.sent2: The unfeelingnesses of the robot made it seem cold and distant.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unfeelingnesses, he still managed to show kindness in his own way.
meanings.sent4: The unfeelingnesses of the stone symbolized the harsh reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The unfeelingnesses of the winter wind chilled me to the bone.

meanings.definition: The act of being indifferent or apathetic.
meanings.sent1: His unfeelingnesses towards the suffering of others was concerning.
meanings.sent2: She showed unfeelingnesses towards the news of the tragedy.
meanings.sent3: The unfeelingnesses of the cat towards the mouse was comical.
meanings.sent4: The unfeelingnesses of the mountain stood in stark contrast to the vibrant valley below.
meanings.sent5: The unfeelingnesses of the judge's decision left everyone in shock.

meanings.definition: The absence of compassion or empathy.
meanings.sent1: The unfeelingnesses of the dictator led to widespread suffering.
meanings.sent2: In her eyes, there was a cold unfeelingnesses that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The unfeelingnesses of the rock towards the flower was oddly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The unfeelingnesses of the storm left destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The unfeelingnesses of the ocean swallowed the ship whole.
